intro: Hemitelia karsteniana, commonly known as the Karsten's hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
